abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory,
            with project sustainability, likely. Both World Bank and
            Borrowewr performances are assessed as satisfactory. Lessons
            learned include the following: 1) The establishment of the
            project management unit (PMU) and the Project Steering
            Committee (PSC) proved to be successful but the replication
            of this model for future operations should be advocated and
            adopted only in the absence of public sector reforms which
            would allow similar PMU functions to operate within the
            established ministries' organizational structure. 2)
            With streamlined procurement and payment procedures, the
            Government was able to reduce the turn-around time for the
            award on contracts by roughly 50 percent with similar
            improvements in efficiencies for payments to contractors and
            consultants realized. 3) The financial and technical
            quarterly audits undertaken by a private audit firm assisted
            the PMU greatly in ensuring that the streamlined procurement
            and payment procedures did not sacrifice proper oversight of
            the expenditure of public funds. 4) Improved public
            relations efforts were made by the PMU to inform the public
            of the progress of the project. This should be adopted for
            all Govenrment projects but most certainly for all future
            IDA financed projects.
